titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Franklin Gibson, William Morgan, Stephen Young, and George Pilant, Indictment
CWG5591

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Crittenden Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against
Franklin Gibson William Morgan Stephen Young, George Pilant

The Grand Jury of Crittenden County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Franklin Gibson William Morgan Stephen Young and George Pilant of the offence of forcibly rescuing a prisoner lawfully detained in jail on a charge of fellony Committed as follows namely The said Franklin Gibson William Morgan Stephen Young and George Pilant did on the 15th day of November 1865 in the County aforesaid forcibly rescue from the jail of Crittenden County one James Guest therein lawfully detained by order of the Crittenden Circuit Court on charge of felony, against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

D H Hughes atty
protem for Comth

Witnesses=
W H Hughes David Woods Wm Rushing Ephraim Hill
A Copy Attest J H Walker C C C C

Comth of Ky
vs } Copy of Indictment
Franklin Gibson &c
